result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Colombo Bonaccorso

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antonio Colombo Bonaccorso appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Antonio Colombo Bonaccorso.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is unable to pass the Milwaukee County health protocol screening. Due to defendant being ill, defense requests adjournment. Court grants defense's request.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 30.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Branch 30 is in jury trial. Plea/sentencing hearing rescheduled off the record by email to 10-18-2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Antonio Colombo Bonaccorso in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Antonio Colombo Bonaccorso.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a plea and sentencing. Parties are still in negotiations and therefore cannot proceed with a plea and sentencing today. Case rescheduled.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Antonio Colombo Bonaccorso in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Antonio Colombo Bonaccorso appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requests to resolve the case through a plea and sentencing.
Case adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Antonio Colombo Bonaccorso in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl. Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Antonio Colombo Bonaccorso appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and requests adjournment to review with client. Case adjourned to Br 30.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Little Caesars Pizza, 4208 W. Greenfield Ave., West Milwaukee, WI, KT, BT.

Defendant Antonio Colombo Bonaccorso in court.  Student Intern Caroline Pellegrini under the supervision of Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antonio Colombo Bonaccorso not in court. Defendant informed the court that he was exposed to COVID-19 and would like an adjournment. Court granted adjournment.
Case adjourned back to OCCR.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/27/2022@2:30pm
